bow: we want to get the minimum amount of baby stuff as possible what is absolutely necessary and what is superfluous we live in studio apt in nyc and are expecting our first child know know studio apt that another discussion we want to be as minimal as possible and not buy into the whole mommy industry that makes you think you need million new gadgets wiper warmers bitch please what is the absolute necessary and what can we skip our must have list so far crib changing table onesies burp cloths diapers stroller few clothes planning on breastfeeding so that about it swing was crucial for us it was the only way my daughter would nap for the first months well or on me if you do have the space maybe consider rock play those are easy to fold up and come in handy if you are nursing 100 recommend boppy it lifesaver also nipple cream and nursing pads forgive my ignorance nursing pads are inserts in your bra in case you leak yes and they are must in the beginning you will leak for while preferred to use the disposable ones as never found reusable one liked but maybe someone else can recommend good one do you even need changing table you could just get the waterproof pads to put the baby on the floor also you may want to look into your hospital requirement as far as car seats some make you have one even if you do have car live in pittsburgh where almost everyone drives everywhere but remember reading about this somewhere ooh great tip re changing table yeah that makes total sense agree changing tables are worth the space they take up had one that was dresser underneath it ended up using the changing pad from my diaper bag all the time so could change on the floor bed wherever loved the fold up portable swing moved it around in every room in my house even put him in it in the bathroom while was showering lifesaver deleted any thoughts on using pack and play whatever that is or just having baby sleep in bed with you instead of crib is there any reason why you chose that over baby bjorn deleted pack amp play fold up playpen basically is great when they are very small if you get the one with the bassenette attachment you are probably still going to want crib eventually if you do plan to co sleep because the pack amp play mattresses are that great for an older heavier baby my 16 month old will nap in hers but wakes up too much if she has to sleep in it all night this also explains the difference in how the hips can be supported http www hipdysplasia org developmental dysplasia of the hip prevention baby carriers seats and other equipment this somewhat depends on the baby for instance we got burp cloths and never used them she just never spit up much or needed burping however add few bottles and some kind of pump to your list unless you are planning on being away from baby for more than two hours for 6+ months actually found our changing table very useful because it corralled all the appropriate supplies and she soon knew what to expect when we put her on it however until baby is born all you need is the car seat and or carrier like our lillebaby clothes and diapers our girl slept with us and it worked out great if you realize you need other things after the baby here it really not that big deal to go out and get them deleted strike the burp cloths receiving blankets work just as well the negativity surrounding the baby bjorn appeared when another company introduced competing product theres not one documented case of the baby bjorn ever causing any issues period have one and love it edit thanks disgruntled downvoter here an interesting take on that http skeptoid com blog 2013 01 25 will the babybjorn endanger your infants health repeat **there has not been one single documented incidence of the baby bjorn causing hip dysplasia ** it is so frustrating to watch hysteria and judgement like this spread through the online community rumour mill our crib was waste my week old sleeps in bed with me think changing table is not must have must haves thermometer diaper cream baby carrier gripe water pacifiers bottles bottle brush add some warm blankets to your list you are allowed to put babies in coats and then strap them in car seat so blankets are must for any kind of car travel and you will be told not to let them baby get too warm but my babies liked to be snuggled up in fleece blankets for practically the entire winter if you are using car but instead will be pushing the baby in stroller lot get baby bunting buy your clothes second hand you will be amazed at how much great quality stuff is on sale all the time because people overbuy for kids who are growing fast pack and play with the bassinet and changer vibrating chair or swing will be life saver onesies do go crazy with baby clothes and buy gently used they grow out of them before you know it and make mess would spend bunch of money on name brand diapers and wipes targets up and up or kirkland costco are what we prefer and we ve tried every brand travel system stroller and baby bjorne well we bought 15 infantino one and use it all the time and little grooming kit is nice to have their fingernails become weapons pretty fast oh little sack gown sleepers they make diaper changes easier faster in the middle of the night thing learned with is that babies speed through phases and stuff can feel like waste even when it is necessary for few months we co slept for the first couple of months but our bed was small so hacked an ikea changing table into co sleeper that worked for her until she could worm out of it that when we transitioned her to crib lot of people swear by pack play for travel but you could probably make it do double duty for the first year as baby bed both at home and away many of them come with changing table attachment too so in that way it does triple the work alternatively you could find in crib ikea has great affordable one that has two crib heights then when baby is ready to transition you take off one side then at the next stage another and it serves as toddler bed which can last them nicely til about or years old you can live without the changing table just use bath towel under baby and change on the couch or bed figure out way to set up everything you need for changing diapers to keep it close to where you make the baby changing area did find it easiest if one place was where we always did it that way no looking around for where the supplies were last used ll be honest diaper pail is nice to have if you can figure out the space those things stink to high heaven and you will not want to be running your trash out after every couple of changes as for stroller very few strollers can be used for an infancy without car seat until about months when baby can support their own head so many strollers are big and bulky it might be worth considering getting car seat that works with snap go stroller frame the frames are super compact when folded the car seat has to come out when folded they have good storage underneath and you can sell it after months when baby can move to regular stroller then purchase higher end umbrella stroller that folds up as compactly as possible you ll learn lot over that time period to know what type of stroller handling is important to you swear we ended up with different strollers for partly because we were in nanny share but also because we bought one and hated its handling so the cheap snap go is great way to save money and space while figuring out what you really need you will probably want bouncer of some sort not any of the major contraptions just something on simple sort of stand that vibrates and has little bit of visual stimulation it does take bit of room in the place but you can find way to store it when not in use sure this is great for getting baby out of the car seat into something that wo flatten their head soothes them for napping visual stimulation and very importantly keeps them safe and entertained when you want to take bath you can also use it as an initial highchair when first starting food talking about something like this http www toysrus com product index jsp productid=19346836 amp cp=2255957 2273443 2255983 2256084 amp parentpage=family you also should consider play mat or gym for tummy time some are super excessive some super simple some of them are made to pick up and store relatively easy as well this is good for development and stimulation as well baby carrier in addition to stroller is good idea too if you have place you can try different ones out that would be ideal do know that go only with carrier it really depends on your lifestyle and how you will need to navigate you world oh you probably should get diaper bag keeping everything you need for going out in one thing always in the same place helps lot do recommend diaper bag over just messenger bag or backpack used as one because baby stuff leaks lot having something made for easy cleaning when food pouches pop or bottles leak is really handy but get something both parents will be cool with carrying an avid baby wearer and generally against prolonged use of bjorn and similar carriers and agree with la pepina there has been no documented cases of narrow crotch carriers causing hip issues my problems with it are that it just look so damn uncomfortable for the baby mean try imagining myself sitting like that for hours and no thanks my back would hurt my crotch would hurt it just generally seems so damn uncomfortable plus while no specific cases have been documented there may be some risk to families that have history of hip displasia like mine but not for the general public if you pick up baby it natural instincts are to curve around you in seated position not just hang there like in bjorn it seems like no brainer to me to go with carrier that mimics the way baby natural positions itself against you there also the over stimulation factor which is not something really put much stock in until my nephew came around he has some issues due to drugs his birth mother took during pregnancy and if there too much going on around him he can get really agitated my brother and sister in law tried wearing him facing out so he could see things and he hated it after about five minutes but whenever babysat put him in carrier facing in on my back and he happily stay in there for hours while did other things he could still look around and see but whenever things got to be too much he could snuggle in and block things out also while know everyone is different it seems like many many more people complain about how uncomfortable bjorns and other carries with similar strap configurations are for the wearer many people seem to complain of back pain since all the weight of the baby is put on the upper back unlike with certain other carriers that distribute weight across the entire back and onto the hips really like my ergo but the only reason have it is because it was on major sale down to 70 from the usual 140 mei tais are really easy to use and great for all ages and can be easily transferred between different users they re significantly cheaper as well infanto makes one ve seen them at walmart for around 30 my son slept next to the bed in the pack and play bassinet for the first three months then we moved him into his nursery and crib he naps at grandma in pack and play and when we go on vacations he sleeps in one you could absolutely use only pnp though would recommend figuring out something for the mattress the thin one it comes with probably is great for long periods of time you could also look into mini cribs they re smaller than regular cribs well duh but are cheaper and for most babies will work until the time they can be moved into real bed co sleeping is certainly an option we do because my fiance is very heavy sleeper and both of us move lot in our sleep so he had worries about it and now the kiddo is used to being able to flop all over his crib to his sleeping heart content so all of us trying to sleep together just does not work but for many families co sleeping is great option do know about the other poster but we love our ergo and when the baby was young we exclusively used moby wrap diapers wipes carseat baby clothes changing mat for when you leave the house safe place to set baby such as crib or pack and play or bassinet or swing breastfeeding pillow is so nice to have did use one till little man was about months old wish had gotten it from the begining you do not need stroller they can be nice for when baby is bigger but just used this front pack thing when he was smaller we never got hold of the sling it was great for when he did want to be set down but did want to tire my arms any longer also if breastfeeding you probably wo need big thing of baby powder should have just purchased travel size container get package of newborn and size diapers my little man fit in newborn diapers all of days he chunker by the way huggies tend to be wider than pampers use the nicer brand diapers feel that they hold up to blowouts better than store brand like having changing table they are not necessary but if you find changing table dresser it is good buy you can store baby things in the changing station that way would suggest no crib get an in bed cosleeper or use drawer with padding or cosleep straight if you have large firm mattress and are careful about blankets pillows no changing table you can put changing pad anywhere onesies yes burp cloths yes or at least rags the best ones may be cut up old sheets soft diapers yes stroller baby carrier is as good or better clothes yes you also need baby wipes thermometer although you may get one at the hospital sleep sack or three is very useful hats they fall under the clothes category but you need sun hats and winter hats at some point you will need car seat you yourself will need some gentle nursing bras remember that your boobs will grow so you need something with stretch that still provides some support lanolin cream too if you ever plan on being away from the baby for more than an hour or so you will need some kind of pump plus bottles bags for storage but that can wait it may be covered under insurance if there are birth complications recommend biting the bullet and buying something high end medela pump in style is great hand pumps never worked for me and hand expression was barely better aside from that it sounds like you ve got the right attitude have used thermometer diaper cream or pacifiers think my son used bottle about times he did like it bottle brishes are not needed if you are bottle feeding add pump bottles and milk freezer bags to your list freezing pumped milk will give you some freedom to go out with the girls one night or whatever or if like some women your supply drops if you get sick few bottles worth in the freezer is nice to have if you re able to be home and are only going to need to pump sometimes handpump would probably suffice but if you want to pump regularly like if you re going back to work really invest in an electric double pump none of that really takes up much space we had way too many clothes most were hand me downs but he did need even half of what he fit into that first year most of our burp cloths were those cheapo flat white cotton diapers receiving blankets work great as well that what my brother and sister in law have used for their two kids changing table is necessary we have one that was given to us but plan on getting rid of it before we have our second the top of dresser or any other surface works just as well stroller is not necessary if you have carrier but that sort of personal choice for everyone think we used our stroller about three times total the first year but there are plenty of people who use it almost daily so it really up to your needs know lots of babies like them but my son did have much interest in the swing we used it few times but could have easily done without it we did have bouncer seat though with an activity bar over the top and vibration feature it took up significantly less space than the swing and he preferred it and of course there plenty of little things you ll need that do take up space like butt cream one thing that was bit of an indulgence that we could not have done without aden anais lightweight blankets could never get good swaddle with the standard cotton receiving blankets but with the a+a blankets could get good one every time and because of their size they were great as nursing covers they re not as heavy as the specified covers think thermometer is nice just in case though my son had fever randomly the other day and liked being able to monitor it did breastfeed but did notice that my mommy friends who did also went along with the pumping route which would make having bottles handy suppose same here on wasting money for crib and changing table especially with limited space cosleeping and pad on the floor were fine for me maybe spend the on an extra dresser or cabinet to store all the kid stuff in you do need something to put them in when you want to have shower or cut up raw meat etc and in our tiny house the swing was the go to device it folded up there is so much mama made stuff that you might like as alternatives if you are interested in putting your money into the gerber etc baby machine check out etsy for nursing pads burp cloths diaper covers diaper bags all sorts of useful things do search for finnish baby box and you definitely wo be disappointed if you get the disposable ones the lansinoh brand is must the other brands are krinkley and really obvious looking like you have headlights on your boobs yes love love love my ergo for my older child but the moby wrap is little more comfortable for infants imo yep changing tables are waste the floor bed or couch work just fine my baby had her own room with the crib and changing table and all but honestly for the first months felt like was living in studio everything took place in my bedroom highly recommend this type of pack play http www disneybaby com blog 2012 the year of the pack play it has the vibrating amp nature sounds newborn napper where my lo slept until she got too long it has changing table right next to the napper so at am could move her foot to change her and not risk her peeing all over my bed it has the bassinet height mattress thingy so when she grew out of the napper could put her there to nap play sleep and still use the changing table thingy there is also pouch for diapers amp changing necessities and now have the pack play to use as play pen ezswaddles just but another thing used every night for the first few months and it was so much easier than trying to swaddle with blanket in the middle of the night for burp cloths recommend old school cloth diapers they are pretty but they are thick amp absorbent and get the job done use them as burp cloth also lay one under her head when she sleeps in case she spits up or drools massively use pee pads for under her booty in bed and on the changing table but these could do that job as well you missed car seat they wo let you leave the hospital without one if you are planning to get stroller try to find travel system so you can get package deal and the car seat and stroller will work together if you are going to be working then do worry about an electric pump you may want manual but that just when had to go home for night without my baby had to get pump asap edit sorry was finished impromptu meeting walked into my office some type of baby bathing aparatus could be as simple as the spongy material thing you lay in your sink or tub for them to lay on just something to keep them steady for you to wash them down deleted deleted deleted crib do need just the mattress on the floor or small drawer will work if you absolutely must have an area pack amp play will work changing table pad on the bed floor will work just as well waste of money onesies you can get these for cheap 25cents each or less at yard sales burp cloths you do need special burp cloths clean kitchen towels will work you do need to use any special baby laundry detergent anything free of dye and perfumes should be fine diapers if you are home you can easily forgo these look up elimination communication stroller in nyc you might as well use your child as battering ram just get an ergonomic carrier not the naturino or anything that puts all the baby weight on their crotch with the legs dangling and also something that is comfy for you to carry for long time few clothes yard sale consignment shops for cheap edit some kind of lotion ointment for dry skin and diaper rash suction bulb for baby snot nail clippers they can really scratch the crap out of themselves nursing cover and or bottles pump depending on how comfortable you feel nursing in public carseat if you have car if not disregard swaddling blanket this is hit or miss but most children of people know enjoyed being swaddled at the beginning few months see if you can find some used muslin ones wipes lots of and lots of wipes my kids do even use diapers and still carry wipes around they are so great for everything your mileage may vary one child loved the swing the other one of my children would not go near it and would scream bloody murder personally gave up on the nursing pads and used folded paper towels or panty liners used them out of desperation once because all my reusable ones were in the wash and then it kinda stuck pack amp play worked well until about 15 or 16 months for my youngest one when we travelled she sleeps on mattress on the floor and did not have to be supervised in the mattress after 15 months or so almost everyone leaks and it small box or reusable ones keep the crazy down in small apartment pack and plays are great some kids sleep in them till they get bed plus it bed that travels as needed baby nail clippers are needed gripe water can be bought last minute as needed yeah think it the johnson amp johnson ones that have built in nipples so no matter what it looks like your turkeys are done have you thought about pack play instead of crib that way if you go anywhere you ll have bed for baby and if you need extra space when baby is sleeping you can fold it up you can also get swings that lock in place and vibrate like bounce seat if you re thinking about getting either of those you said burp cloths do not skimp on these get ton or use cloth diapers unless you plan on doing the laundry all the time you will burn through these things like crazy with all the booby leakage and spit up would have at least 10 soiled every day for the first few weeks also get breast pump if you plan on breastfeeding even if things are going smoothly there may be time where you need this to either get things going or to save precious milk you may be overproducing also having nipple shield on hand is good in case you end up needing it so you do have to run out to the store in desperation you ll definitely get the hang of breastfeeding but you ca predict what crazy path you ll need to take to get there swing or little vibrating chair is really good too sometimes you need to have free hands or even just take shower having safe and comforting place to put baby is godsend to add to the anti bjorn posts all the weight is on your shoulders at around 15 pounds it starts to get really uncomfortable also you ca nurse in it and the weight limit is low if you are on an ergo prohibiting budget go for mei tai target and etsy sell them or they are easy to sew deleted recommend putting the changing pad on dresser or something rather than the floor doing all the diaper changes on the floor would not be kind to your back we have ours on top of our filing cabinet baby bathtub of some sort it ll be awhile before you can bathe the baby in normal tub and while you *could* do it in the bathroom sink the baby would probably either be too small for the sink alone as newborn or outgrow the sink before being big enough for the regular tub unless you re super neat people would recommend relying on the kitchen sink to bathe baby because it will probably have dirty dishes in it they make ones that fold up we re also short on space and for baby gear in general ve found that searching for the travel versions of things helps you ll also want somewhere you can safely put the baby down when they re very young it helps for this to be swing bouncy seat or playgym so they have toys to look at bat at blanket on the floor is fine for tummy time do just put them on the carpet you ca throw the carpet in the laundry when the kid spits up but if you have non carpeted floors get rug grip so it wo slide around when they move know lot of other posters are recommending just getting carrier but would recommend at least researching strollers so you have one picked out in case you need it had big baby and rough recovery so it was month or so before recovered enough to use carrier comfortably and my son cried in them until he could hold his head up because the newborn head support blocked his view of the world plus there are some situations when you need somewhere to put the baby down if you do have friends family who could come with you to hold the baby when you have doctor appointment you ll want stroller exam rooms do come with baby seats this is definitely the sort of thing that depends lot on your lifestyle your health and your baby temperament so do the research at least highly recommend that you check out some local boutique type baby stores you do need to buy from there if they re overpriced but they re great place to try out products for yourself things like carriers it really best to try first our local store had sandbag so you could try it with weight bibs nail scissors nosefrida the boppy is awesome even if you re not nursing use it all the time to prop the baby up so can sing talk to him at good angle to see my face and now we re starting to use it to support him as he learns to sit up often put him in the boppy on my bed while get dressed in the morning or fold laundry so he can watch me we bottle feed but ve used it almost every day pack and play is basically what they used to call playpens but the brand name eclipsed the generic now they make them so the mattress height can be adjusted and the fancier models have little bassinet and changer on top those are very small though so you ll only use them briefly so we just went with the simple model agree having changing table has saved my back have back pain from spending 14 years in retail on concrete floors having the baby has made it worse so having changing table has definitely helped that so true guy worked with brought me ton of his son clothing that he outgrown there were two pairs of air jordans sneakers almost brand new and still in their boxes they cost 30 each and he said his son wore them twice crazy gt she just never spit up much omg more jealous of this than when people post how their wk old slept through the night so much spit up last night had to scrape it out of the car seat haha grass is always greener take carseat scraping if it meant had had to go through so many months of her waking up every damn hour just changed my baby on the bed with diaper changing mat of course also bought cloth diapers that used when my baby had rash but also as burp cloth as needed for just about anything if you plan on breastfeeding and having some time to yourself you definitely need breast pump and just couple of bottles and nips so you can dip out speaking of breastfeeding it can be pretty rough in the first few days before production starts so you might want to think about contingency just supplementing one feed day with some formula in case that happens to be problem for you in which case pump is pretty vital just something thought you might want to think about used to live in nyc too and just to check have you looked at clementine consignment in the west village know this thread is about not buying unnecessary things but have to ask because they have just the most adorable things ever there and my heart melts oh was back in the city last summer and got my then nine month old the most adorable swimsuit in the world definitely get snap go got given one and its way better than the expensive pram regret buying we ve had consistantly used cloth wipes or cheap washcloths used these folded up as nursing pads bassinet that rolls it doubles as portable changing table and makeshift walker post partum we have graco all terrain stroller which is rad we have crib side carred to the bed find another mom you can get hand me downs from to try stuff out invaluable
